revised_title: Tobacco Smoking and Pipe Designs in New Guinea
tldr: This study examines the smoking of tobacco and tobacco pipe designs in New Guinea, exploring the origins of the custom, the distribution of techniques and styles, and the potential influences of cultural diffusion. The author analyzes over 250 tobacco pipe specimens from various museums and discusses the challenges of determining the exact provenance of some pipes. The research provides a comprehensive understanding of tobacco smoking and pipe design in New Guinea.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Anthropology
